metadata.Title: CVE-2021-3733 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description: There's a flaw in urllib's AbstractBasicAuthHandler class. An attacker whocontrols a malicious HTTP server that an HTTP client (such as web browser)connects to, could trigger a Regular Expression Denial of Service (ReDOS)during an authentication request with a specially crafted payload that issent by the server to the client. The greatest threat that this flaw posesis to application availability.

criterions.comment: python3.5: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
